item.title: Ladislas Ntaganzwa, Top Suspect in Rwandan Genocide, Is Arrested
item.description: The United Nations said Mr. Ntaganzwa, one of nine remaining fugitives sought for his role in the 1994 genocide, was arrested this week in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: JOSH KRON

item.title: Finnish Police Arrest Iraqi Twins Linked to ISIS Massacre in 2014
item.description: The arrests announced on Thursday threatened to fan an already simmering anti-immigrant backlash in Finland and Europe as a whole.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Geneva Raises Level of Alert for Possible Terrorism Suspects
item.description: The precaution came on the eve of diplomatic talks on Syria between senior American and Russian officials and a United Nations special envoy.
item.dc:creator: NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
item.media:description: Swiss police officers outside the European headquarters of the United Nations in Geneva on Thursday.

item.title: Russian Families Seek Information on Plane Crash in Egypt
item.description: The families of victims filed a legal complaint to compel the government to reveal its lines of inquiry in the crash in October, for which an affiliate of the Islamic State claimed responsibility.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALEXANDRA ODYNOVA

item.title: Turkey Expands Rights of Alevis, a Muslim Minority
item.description: Among the changes, the government will now give legal recognition to Alevi houses of worship, Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu said.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU

item.title: Letter From Europe: Rattled by Terror and Floods, Britain Enters Era of No Quick Fixes
item.description: Parallel tales of terror and weather — the Leytonstone attack and the Lake District flood — seemed to evoke England’s perennial disjunction between north and south.
item.dc:creator: ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: Flooding caused by Storm Desmond in Carlisle, England, last week.

item.title: Mauricio Macri, Argentina’s New President, Sworn In at Ceremony Snubbed by Predecessor
item.description: At the close of an often-divisive presidency, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner boycotted the ceremony for Mauricio Macri after a bitter argument over how and where to hold it.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GILBERT
item.media:description: Argentina's new president, Mauricio Macri, and his wife Juliana Awada in a procession after his inauguration in Buenos Aires on Thursday.

item.title: Save the Planet. Eat Ugly.
item.description: A group called Ugly Mugs says that consuming all the food that is discarded because it is visually unappealing would eliminate one billion tons of carbon emissions a year.
item.category: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
item.dc:creator: CAROLINE CHAUVET
item.media:credit: Dmitry Kostyukov for The New York Times
item.media:description: Nicolas Chabanne shows his vegetables during an exhibition in the Grand Palais in Paris on Thursday.

item.title: California and Germany, Opposites With a Common Energy Goal
item.description: Both are trying to develop climate-friendly energy solutions that can serve as a model for countries now meeting in Paris, as they each try to curb carbon emissions.
item.category: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
item.dc:creator: MELISSA EDDY
item.media:description: Solar farms in California. California’s “million solar roof” program mirrored Germany’s “hundred-thousand solar roof” initiative that began a few years ago.

item.title: Salman Khan, Bollywood Star, Wins Appeal in Hit-and-Run Case
item.description: A court in Mumbai overturned an earlier conviction and five-year sentence over allegations that the actor was driving drunk when he ran over five homeless men.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: The actor Salman Khan, center, on Thursday in Mumbai, India, after a court acquitted him on all charges in a fatal hit-and-run case from 2002.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Let Israel Fight ISIS
item.description: It’s time for Washington and its Arab allies to admit that Israel is an ally, not an enemy, in the fight for a better Middle East.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: SHMUEL ROSNER

item.title: News Analysis: China’s Polluted Skies Take On a Darker Meaning for Its Leaders
item.description: Official measures have increased public awareness but also raised questions about whether Beijing is up to the challenge of cleaning up the environment.
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: After the Beijing government sounded a red alert over air pollution, sales of masks and air purifiers soared.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: China’s Dangerous Ambiguity in the South China Sea
item.description: Beijing’s passive-aggressive behavior over disputes in the South China Sea is designed to undermine U.S. influence in Asia.
item.dc:creator: LISELOTTE ODGAARD

item.title: Fleeing Thailand, Top Investigator of Human Trafficking Says He Fears for His Safety
item.description: Maj. Gen. Paween Pongsirin, who led an inquiry into mass graves near the border with Malaysia, plans to seek asylum in Australia.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Rescue workers and forensic experts at the site of a mass grave in Thailand's southern Songkhla Province in May. More than 90 defendants were charged after an investigation.

item.title: Afghan Spy Chief Quits After Denouncing Talks With Pakistan
item.description: Rahmatullah Nabil, a favorite of American officials, criticized President Ashraf Ghani’s trip to Islamabad in a scathing message on Facebook before resigning.
item.dc:creator: MUJIB MASHAL
item.media:credit: Lorenzo Tugnoli for The New York Times
item.media:description: Rahmatullah Nabil at his office in Kabul, Afghanistan, in 2014. Mr. Nabil resigned as his country’s intelligence chief on Thursday.

item.title: Chinese Rights Lawyer’s Trial Over Online Comments to Begin Soon
item.description: The long-delayed case is scheduled to start next week, and the Communist Party-controlled court is virtually certain to convict the lawyer, Pu Zhiqiang.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Pu Zhiqiang, a prominent civil rights lawyer.

item.title: Donald Trump Pushes Back at British Petition to Bar Him
item.description: The presidential candidate’s comments that Muslims should be barred from the United States prompted an online petition calling for him to be refused entry into Britain.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Sinosphere: Amid China’s Smog Worries, One More: Counterfeit Masks
item.description: A report said the Shanghai authorities had seized 120,000 counterfeit surgical masks, the kind commonly worn to protect against polluted air.
item.dc:creator: VANESSA PIAO
item.media:description: People in Beijing wearing face masks on Wednesday. Such masks have become an increasingly common sight in China in recent years.

item.title: Delegates at Climate Talks Focus on Saving the World’s Forests
item.description: If a deal is reached, nations — particularly tropical countries — will have agreed to sharp reductions in deforestation, and in some cases to ending it.
item.category: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
item.dc:creator: JUSTIN GILLIS
item.media:credit: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times
item.media:description: The canopy of the forest in Puerto Viejo, Costa Rica, in October 2014. Climate change negotiations in Paris could lead to a sweeping effort to save the world's forests.

item.title: As It Fights ISIS, Pentagon Seeks String of Bases Overseas
item.description: The bases would serve as hubs for Special Operations troops and intelligence agents who would conduct counterterrorism missions for the foreseeable future.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT
